definitions.definition: a strong written or spoken attack (on someone):
examples: The candidate fired/launched yet another broadside at the president.

definitions.definition: the action of firing all the guns on one side of a navy ship at the same time

examples: The car was hit broadside. The front and rear were undamaged.

definitions.definition: to hit something on one of its longer sides:
examples: A vehicle broadsided the police car on the passenger side.
